update.description:
Notes:

 * Uuid own implementation with the windows API
 * VS2013 is buggy with initializer list on maps, I made them explicit 
 * There was a [problem](https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/753115/steady-clock-class-and-clock-function-are-non-conformant-with-c-11-and-c11-standards) with steady_clocks in VS2013 and c++11
 * Implement the cmake variable `CPPZMQ_HEADER_PATH` to help cppzmq detection
 * setenv is not POSIX, implement it for windows.

I will submit a different PR for the port of the test suite.
update.title: Support for windows compilation

content.raw: This branch works for me in that I can build and install on Windows, and then build another package that uses ign-transport.
content.html: This branch works for me in that I can build and install on Windows, and then build another package that uses ign-transport.

update.title: Support for windows compilation

content.raw:
I peeked at the [drone.io console output](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/186) and it complains about `-Wpointer-sign`
~~~
cc1plus: warning: command line option ‘-Wpointer-sign’ is valid for C/ObjC but not for C++ [enabled by default]
~~~
content.html:
I peeked at the drone.io console output and it complains about -Wpointer-sign

cc1plus: warning: command line option ‘-Wpointer-sign’ is valid for C/ObjC but not for C++ [enabled by default]

content.raw: [drone.io](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/186) is happy and @gerkey was using with this branch without major problems to install it just fine on a Windows7. I plan to merge this during today.
content.html: drone.io is happy and @gerkey was using with this branch without major problems to install it just fine on a Windows7. I plan to merge this during today.
